content.html:
I'm Ari Bader-Natal. I design, build, and operate online learning environments that help people access new opportunities and create new futures. (You might call my work "Learning Engineering.")
I am co-founder and CTO at Sparkwise, where I lead product and engineering. At Sparkwise, we help develop world-class teams and leaders through multiplayer challenges.
From 2019-2021, I served as the founding CTO at Calbright College. Calbright is a fully-online competency-based college in the California Community Colleges system designed for working adults who lack easy access to traditional forms of higher education.
Before this, I served as Chief Learning Scientist at Minerva Project. I joined Minerva as Employee #1 in 2012, and spent 7 years creating new tools to support learning and teaching, including Minerva's first Active Learning Forum, tools for formative assessment, and collaborative curriculum authoring system.
In 2010, I built Studio Sketchpad, a place for creative coders to collaboratively create interactive animations in Processing (and later P5.js.) In addition to serving as a venue for informal learning, Sketchpad has been used by 100+ universities, high schools, and coding workshops. Notably, this service has been running for 12+ years.
Recently liked:
  • Web: The future, soon: what I learned from Bing’s AI
  • Web: ChatGPT Is a Blurry JPEG of the Web
  • Web: Sandboxing JavaScript Code

  • Web: Protocols, APIs, and conventions
  • Playing with ActivityPub
  • Web: The unreasonable effectiveness of one-on-ones

  • Journalistic Lessons for the Algorithmic Age – The Markup

 Sparkwise logo 
I am co-founder and CTO at Sparkwise, where I lead product and engineering. At Sparkwise, we help develop world-class teams and leaders through multiplayer challenges.


 Calbright logo 
From 2019-2021, I served as the founding CTO at Calbright College.
Calbright is a fully-online competency-based college in the California Community Colleges system designed for working adults who lack easy access to traditional forms of higher education.

Before this, I served as Chief Learning Scientist at Minerva Project. I joined Minerva as Employee #1 in 2012, and spent 7 years creating new tools to support learning and teaching, including Minerva's first Active Learning Forum, tools for formative assessment, and collaborative curriculum authoring system.

In 2010, I built Studio Sketchpad, a place for creative coders to collaboratively create interactive animations in Processing (and later P5.js.) In addition to serving as a venue for informal learning, Sketchpad has been used by 100+ universities, high schools, and coding workshops. Notably, this service has been running for 12+ years.

note.value:
Ari Bader-Natal 

I'm Ari Bader-Natal. I design, build, and operate online learning environments that help people access new opportunities and create new futures. (You might call my work "Learning Engineering.")

https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/pock.title: The past few days have been some of the most troubling and exciting days in the short history of generative AI. And I think everyone needs to understand why. In case you missed it, Microsoft integrated a version of ChatGPT with a search engine, gave it a personality, and released it as Bing AI.
https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/pock.text: Web: The future, soon: what I learned from Bing’s AI

https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/pock.title: In 2013, workers at a German construction company noticed something odd about their Xerox photocopier: when they made a copy of the floor plan of a house, the copy differed from the original in a subtle but significant way.
https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/pock.text: Web: ChatGPT Is a Blurry JPEG of the Web

https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/pock.title: I’ve been enjoying playing around on Val Town lately. Val Town can be described a few ways; a cloud scripting site, a runnable github gists, or end-programmer programming. I first came across it in a Show HN thread. A “val” is a JavaScript/TypeScript function or value that runs on our servers.

When Kyle Cornforth first walked into IDEO’s San Francisco offices in 2011, she felt she had entered a whole new world. At the time, Cornforth was a director at the Edible Schoolyard Project, a nonprofit that uses gardening and cooking in schools to teach and to provide nutritious food.
https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/pock.text: Web: Design thinking was supposed to fix the world. Where did it go wrong?

https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/pock.title: A bit of exciting news. I’m joining Obsidian full-time as CEO! ✨ I have been using Obsidian and developing for it since Silver and Licat first launched in 2020. I can’t overstate how life-changing Obsidian has been for me. It has fundamentally improved the way I think.
https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/pock.text: Web: I’m joining Obsidian full-time as CEO

https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/pock.title: The idea of being able to track ones position when moving predates the invention of Global Positioning Systems (GPS) and the personal navigation devices that have followed.
https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/pock.text: Web: Before There was GPS: Personal Navigation in the early 20th Century

https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/unca.title: The cocktails most frequently ordered in American bars have changed a lot recent years. Due to the exertions of young bartenders eager to get their clientele to drink better spirits and beverages, the fortunes of old standards like the Old-Fashioned, Manhattan and Negroni, among others, have risen.
https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/unca.text: In Search of the Ultimate Margarita

https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/pock.title: We’ve worked on a lot of different types of websites: static sites for credit card companies, social media platforms, learning management systems, content management systems, and e-commerce to name a few. We’ve also trained hundreds of development teams with our training company, React Training.

Most teaching and learning today at schools, and universities, primarily involves getting children and adults to memorize the manual to a proverbial game. We don’t or sometimes can’t assess whether they know how to play said game so settle for the regurgitation of information.
https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/pock.text: Web: We knew it was broken. Now we might just have to fix it.

https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/unca.title: The Fediverse has been a hot topic of discussion lately, with thousands, if not millions, of new users creating accounts on platforms like Mastodon to either move entirely to “the other side” or experiment and learn about this new social network.
https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/unca.text: Welcome to Wildebeest: the Fediverse on Cloudflare

https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/pock.title: The Fediverse is wired together by protocols like ActivityPub and WebFinger which, as yet, I know very little about. That’s because the Steampipe plugin, which supports the dashboards I’ve been building and describing in this series, doesn’t require me to understand or use those protocols.

https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/unca.title: ActivityPub, WebFinger, and Mastodon are getting some attention because of chaos at Twitter. It’s anyone’s guess how this all shakes out. As an active user of Twitter, it’ll be sad if it goes away. But in the meantime, let’s have some fun with ActivityPub.

https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/pock.title: When I started dating my partner, I quickly noticed that grad school was making her very sad.
https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/pock.text: Web: The unreasonable effectiveness of one-on-ones

https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/unca.title: ChatGPT, a chat bot powered by artificial intelligence released in late 2022, continues to transfix the internet. Ask it to write you some code. It will oblige. Ask it to write you some legal boilerplate. It’s yours. Major search engines are rushing to merge its technology.
https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/unca.text: Three Tests AI Needs to Pass Before It Can Start to Transform Teaching

https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/unca.title: I’m sad to inform you that this is my last missive to you. After founding The Markup five years ago, I am departing this newsroom to pursue other projects. It’s been an honor to correspond with all of you, dear readers, and I am so humbled by all of you who supported my vision.
https://favorites.aribadernatal.com/unca.text: Journalistic Lessons for the Algorithmic Age – The Markup
